titles.title: Soukyuu no Fafner: Dead Aggressor - Exodus
Fafner in the Azure: Exodus
창궁의 파프너 EXODUS
蒼穹のファフナー Dead Aggressor EXODUS
蒼穹之法芙娜 EXODUS

relatedanime.anime: Soukyuu no Fafner: Dead Aggressor - Exodus (2015)
Soukyuu no Fafner: Dead Aggressor - Heaven and Earth

recommendations.recommendation: 11 years of wait seems to be worth, hope whole series keeps up with the awesome start!

anime.description: Note: First and second episodes received a special pre-air on December 27, 2014. Regular TV airing started on January 9, 2015.

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: robot
tag.description: A robot is an automatically guided machine, able to do tasks on its own. Another common characteristic is that by its appearance or movements, a robot often conveys a sense that it has intent or agency of its own. Not to be confused with android (human-like robot).

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: piloted robot
tag.description: Piloted Robots are, as the name suggests, robots that cannot control themselves; they need to be steered from somewhere, this can be from a human sitting inside or a remote controlled option.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: DESCRIPTION MISSING
tag.description: The description for this entry is missing. e.g plot, biography... Please help by adding it, and remove this tag afterwards. Thank you.

tag.name: daikaijuu
tag.description: Literally translating to giant monster, daikaiju is an element found often in Japanese entertainment. Although usually for the science fiction genre it is also often used in horror, fantasy, mecha, and to a lesser extent comedy. Any monster that towers over a house technically qualifies as a daikaiju. Some anime, usually mecha, will go as far as calling their daikaiju with a specific title.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-anime projects
tag.description: Many anime are created as part of larger projects encompassing many shows without direct relation to one another. Normally, there is a specific idea in mind: for example, the http://anidb.net/t4859 [Young Animator Training Project] aims to stimulate the on-the-job training of next-generation professionals of the anime industry, whereas the http://anidb.net/t3763 [World Masterpiece Theatre] aims to animate classical stories from all over the world.

tag.name: Animeism
tag.description: Animeism is a late-night Japanese programming block established in April 2012. It is devoted to anime and broadcast each Thursday night on MBS, in a fashion similar to Fuji TV`s http://anidb.net/t3865 [noitaminA] that also airs on Thursdays. Just like noitaminA, the block airs two series back to back. From April 2015 onwards, the block was moved to Friday nights. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Minashiro Soushi
character.description: Minashiro Soushi is Kazuki`s close friend who is easily identifiable by the large scar from his left eyelid down to his cheek, which was given to him accidentally by Kazuki when they were very young. Soushi`s father is the headmaster of the school on Tatsumiya Island, as well as the commander of Alvis. His mother died while he was still young. He is capable of linking with Fafner robots as well as very skilled at using the Siegfried System.

character.name: Toomi Maya
character.description: Toomi Maya is a childhood friend of both Kazuki and Soshi. She is a very lively girl who enjoys rock climbing. She is very frank about everything she says which gives her an air of reliability... but when it comes to romance she has a long way to go. Her mother, Chizuru, is the only doctor on the whole of Tatsumiya Island. She also has an older sister named Yumiko who works as a teacher for the handicapped. Although her family works a lot in the medical field, Maya herself has never had much skill in the field... in fact, she even has trouble applying a bandage when needed.

character.name: Makabe Kazuki
character.description: Makabe Kazuki is very quiet which makes it seem like he has a cold personality, but he is in fact a very kind and sincere character. He lives with his father Fumihiko who he gets along with very well. Kazuki has a fear of hurting those around him, which causes him to distance himself from everybody - even his friends. He became the pilot of the Fafner Mark Erf two years ago, when he was forced to battle with the Festum.

character.name: Kondou Kenji
character.description: Kondou Kenji is a good-looking young man who doesn`t try to hide who he is - in his opinion school exists for the girls, not the studies. Kenji`s mother, Akino, is a school maths teacher. Kenji sees Kazuki as his rival, but Kazuki does not see him in the same way. Even so, Kenji often challenges Kazuki to various things but is beaten more often than not.

character.name: Kaname Sakura
character.description: Kaname Sakura is the only daughter born into the family that runs the Kaname Dojo on Tatsumiya Island. Her mother, Kiyomi, is a P.E teacher, and her father Seiichiro was a powerful martial artist who was killed in the first assault of the Festum - much to Sakura`s dismay. She now fights against the Festum to continue what her father left behind him.

character.name: Minashiro Tsubaki
character.description: Tatsumiya Island`s Core. Daughter of Kouzou Minashiro and younger sister to Soushi Minashiro. She was born as a core shortly after her mother, Saya Minashiro, was assimilated during the experiment. She teaches Mir what is the meaning of life and death and later sacrifices herself to merge with the newborn core of Tatsumiya Island.

character.name: Tatekami Seri
character.description: Pilot of the Mark Zwölf (XII) in the sequel Heaven and Earth and Exodus and friends with Rina, Akira and Hiroto. Seri develops emotional bond with the island`s core, Tsubaki and Orihime Minashiro.

character.name: Nishio Akira
character.description: Rina`s twin brother. Appears more prominetly in the movies and sequel series. In contrast with his twin sister, Akira is calm and gentle but can be somewhat impulsive too.

character.name: Nishio Rina
character.description: She greatly admires Maya and actively seeks the chance to be praised by her. She also has a crush on Kenji and is a bit shocked hearing that Kenji and Sakura will be marry. Akira`s twin sister. Pilot of the Mark Neun (IX) and Zero Fafner in the sequel Heaven and Earth and Exodus.

character.name: Mikado Reo
character.description: Reo is the oldest trio of the third-generation Fafner pilot of Tatsumiya Island and skillful in sword-art and making pastry. He has a crush on Mimika, although she is yet to be aware of his feeling. Pilot of Fafner Mark XIV (Susanoo)

character.name: Mikagami Mimika
character.description: Pilot of Fafner Mark XV (Tsukuyomi). She idolizes Hiroto Douma and enjoys reading Mobile Samurai Goubain manga while in her spend time. Ultimately, Hiroto passes his Goubain helmet to her before he leaves the island. In the sequel Exodus, her SDP ability is able to create the barrier to hold on the enemies, though it will also form the black spheres on parts of her body and ultimately, her whole body, as the effect of using her SDP ability. It is shown when she pilots her Fafner to her limit when shielding the island from the Festums, making her whole body is assimilated and changed into the black sphere. However, her soul and her mind still retain within. Kazuki saves her eventually, returning to her body to normal.

character.name: Kaburagi Sui
character.description: Pilot of Fafner Mark XVI (Amaterasu). President of Tatsumiyajima Middle School student council. He has a sister named Sanae Kaburagi who was the pilot of Fafner Titan Model and died while participating in the L-Plan as seen in the prequel Right of Left. Sui has a strained relationship with his mother since his sister passed away. He rarely speaks up his mind firmly but as the series progress, find the strength to do so and finally reconciles with his mother.

episode.title: 来訪者
Visitor
Raihousha
episode.summary: June 25, 2150. One of the few surviving locations on Earth populated by humans, Hawaii, was attacked by Festums. The Neo United Nations declared ROE Alpha, burning the island and all its survivors to ashes. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 希望の名は
The Name of Hope
Kibou no Na wa
episode.summary: The Fafners are deployed to save a Human Army transport craft from a Festum. It`s the first battle in two years, but Hiroto, Rina, Akira, Sui, and Maya are all smiles as they calmly board the Fafners. They dominate the battle until the experienced Festum unleashes an attack style they`ve never seen before, leaving the five pilots at a loss. Then unexpected reinforcements arrive... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 継承者たち
The Successors
Keishousha-tachi
episode.summary: Three new pilots have been chosen: Mikado Reo, Kaburagi Sui, and Mikagami Mimika, third-year students at Tatsumiyajima Middle School and juniors to Kazuki and the other pilots. They have received more advanced genetic manipulation than the previous pilots, and each has unique strengths. Hazama Yuuko and Canon prepare their mechs, but the new pilots are dissatisfied with their colors and names... Meanwhile, Fumihiko and Chizuru have the difficult job of notifying the new pilots` families of their children`s new placement. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 対話の代償
The Price of a Conversation
Taiwa no Daishou
episode.summary: Mitsuhiro and the other Human Army pilots visit the café Rakuen on Tatsumiyajima. Billy excitedly devours his curry and Ai takes notice of Kazuki, while Mitsuhiro keeps a close eye on the scene and Maya watches them all with a thoughtful expression. Miwa has met Emery and the two happily converse in some special way that only they understand, while Miwa`s mother, Yumiko, watches with concern. Meanwhile, Fumihiko is shocked by the information offered by General Narain. A frightening situation that could change the world`s balance of power is pressing closer. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 平和を夢見て
Dreaming of Peace
Heiwa o Yumemite
episode.summary: The pilots of Tatsumiyajima are struggling more than they expected in the battle when a new power suddenly springs forth. Sui is left terrified after a brush with death, Reo is frustrated after losing in a sword battle, and Seri begins to doubt the very fact that she`s alive. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新次元戦闘
Battle in a New Dimension
Shin Jigen Sentou
episode.summary: Festums cause chaos by attacking Srinagar, the base where the Tatsumiyajima expeditionary force is stationed, from both inside and outside. Maya runs to Yumiko and Miwa, but is shocked when she sees what Miwa looks like after trying to make contact with a Festum. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 祝福のとき
Blessed Time
Shukufuku no Toki
episode.summary: The expeditionary force, carrying Miwa, arrives at the Srinagar base in India. Towering to the heavens in Srinagar is the World Tree, the Mir revered by the Esperantos. Miwa insists that she wants to speak to it right away, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新世界へ
To a New World
Shin Sekai e
episode.summary: A giant Azazel-type Festum, called a Walker, attacks Tatsumiyajima, having been observing the island since Emery arrived there. The Walker blasts the shields open and sends Sphinx-types and other Festums inside. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦場の子供たち
Children of the Battlefield
Senjou no Kodomo-tachi
episode.summary: An unknown phenomenon has surfaced in all the pilots from the island. It`s clearly an effect of the Fafners` new core, but the Alvis medical team has no idea if it threatens their lives or not, much less how to treat it. Though, Orihime seems to know something about this... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 変貌
Transformation
Henbou
episode.summary: Sui and the other pilots left behind on Tatsumiyajima are going about their individual lives. It appears that the SDP, the phenomenon that occurred during their previous battle to vastly amplify their Fafners` powers, has only influenced them positively. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 希望の地へ
To the Land of Hope
Kibou no Jie
episode.summary: Sein and Nicht rush to destroy the Azazel-type attacking the World Tree. Kazuki shows the boundless power of Sein with its limiters removed, and Soushi expertly manipulates the "uncontrollable" Nicht. Their overwhelming power stirs excitement in the Human Army soldiers as well as the Tatsumiyajima pilots. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 英雄二人
The Two Heroes
Eiyuu Futari
episode.summary: Srinigar is on the verge of destruction after an attack from an Azazel-type. Emery and the others put up a mental wall to defend the World Tree, but it only causes the Festums to corrode their minds. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 闇の中の未来
A Future Within the Darkness
Yami no Naka no Mirai
episode.summary: A group of emigrants who strayed from the main party have been attacked by Festums. The Fafner unit, excluding Kazuki and Soushi, rush to help, but Kazuki insists that the two of them should have gone out in Sein and Nicht. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Episode S1
episode.summary: An expanded version of the first episode
